clinical_study.brief_title: Sofosbuvir With Ribavirin or Simeprevir With HCV GT4 Egyptian Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Sofosbuvir in Combination With Ribavirin or Simeprevir: Real-life Study of Patients With Hepatitis C Genotype 4

brief_summary.textblock: A total of 201 participants with chronic HCV GT4 infection were allocated into two groups. One group participants were treated with SOF plus RBV (24 weeks). The second group was treated with SOF plus SMV (12 weeks).

detailed_description.textblock: A total of 201 participants, treatment-na√Øve and experienced, with chronic HCV GT4 infection were allocated into two groups based on the type of the regimen used. All eligible participants were treated orally with SOF plus daily oral weight-based RBV (24 weeks; group 1), or SOF plus daily oral SMV (12 weeks; group 2).

primary_outcome.description: HCV 12 is HCV RNA level <15 IU/mL at 12 weeks after planned end of treatment (EOT).

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Adverse Events
primary_outcome.time_frame: up for 12 weeks after planned EOT.
primary_outcome.description: An adverse event (AE) is defined as any untoward medical occurrence in a participant clinical investigation administered the drugs of the study. A serious adverse event (SAE) is an event that results in death, life-threatening, participant hospitalization, or disability/incapacity

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Virologic relapse
secondary_outcome.description: Viral relapse was HCV RNA level <15 IU/mL at EOT, but >15 IU/mL levels through 12 weeks after planned EOT

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Virologic null response
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 24 or 36 weeks stating from the first dose
secondary_outcome.description: Virologic null response is defined as HCV RNA >15 IU/mL levels throughout the entire treatment period

arm_group.description: For treatment-naive participants, SOF was given in a dose of 400 mg/day + RBV was given orally in the morning and in the evening (total daily dose was based on body weight:<75 kg, 1000 mg; >75 kg, 1200 mg).

For treatment-experienced participants, SOF was given in a dose of 400 mg/day + RBV was given orally in the morning and in the evening (total daily dose was based on body weight:<75 kg, 1000 mg; >75 kg, 1200 mg).
For treatment-naive participants, SOF was given in a dose of 400 mg/day + SMV orally as a single 150 mg q.d. capsule.
For treatment-experienced participants, SOF was given in a dose of 400 mg/day + SMV orally as a single 150 mg q.d. capsule.

intervention.other_name: Olysio is a trade name of simeprevir
Sovaldi is a trade name of sofosbuvir

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Participants with plasma HCV RNA level >10,000 IU/L for the two groups.
- Treatment-experienced patients in group 1 were those who had previously failed treatment with classical peg-IFN/RBV therapy.
- Treatment-experienced patients in group 2 were those who had previously failed treatment with SOF/RBV
Exclusion Criteria:
- coinfected with hepatitis B virus or human immunodeficiency virus infection,
- any cause of liver disease other than HCV GT4 infection;
- liver decompensation,
- hepatocellular carcinoma,
- major severe illness, such as renal failure, congestive heart failure, thyroid dysfunction, respiratory failure, autoimmune disease and poorly controlled diabetes (HbA1C >9)
- Participants with blood picture abnormalities, such as anemia (hemoglobin concentration of 10 g/or less) and thrombocytopenia (platelet count <50,000 cells/mm3)

link.description: This link describes the effectiveness and safety of two regimens sofosbuvir (SOF) in combination with either ribavirin (RBV) or simeprevir (SMV) in chronic hepatitis C (CHC) genotype (GT) 4 patients in Egypt.
